sen.j: 大石 信清 （おおいし のぶきよ、延宝5年(1677年) - 元禄16年2月4日 (旧暦)（1703年3月20日））は赤穂浪士四十七士の一人。
sen.e: Nobukiyo OISHI (1677 - March 20, 1703) was one of forty-seven samurai of Ako Roshi (lordless samurai of Ako domain).
Nobukiyo OISHI (1677 - March 20, 1703) was one of 47 samurai of Ako Roshi (lordless samurai of the Ako Domain).
sen.cmt: 用語統一リストに従い、数字をアラビア数字にしました。Ako domainとなっていたのを、用語統一リストに従いthe Ako Domainとしました。
sen.e: Nobukiyo OISHI (1677 - March 20, 1703) was one of 47 samurai of Ako Roshi (lordless samurai of the Ako Domain).

sen.j: 赤穂藩では馬廻役150石。
sen.e: He was a horse guard with one hundred and fifty goku (crop yields) in the Ako Domain.
He was umamawariyaku (bodyguard of a general) earning 150 goku (crop yields) in the Ako Domain.
sen.cmt: 用語統一リストに従い、数字をアラビア数字にしました。「馬廻役」と「150石」の意味を明確にしました。
sen.e: He was umamawariyaku (bodyguard of a general) earning 150 goku (crop yields) in the Ako Domain.

sen.j: 幼名は八三郎（はちさぶろう）。
sen.e: His childhood name was Hachisaburo.
His childhood name was Hachisaburo.
His childhood name was Hachisaburo.

sen.j: 通称ははじめ源蔵（げんぞう）、のちに瀬左衛門(せざえもん)。
sen.e: He was commonly called Genzo at first, Sezaemon later.
He was commonly called Genzo at first, Sezaemon later.
He was commonly called Genzo at first, Sezaemon later.

sen.j: 大石信澄の次男として誕生。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Nobuzumi OISHI.
He was born the second son of Nobuzumi OISHI.
He was born the second son of Nobuzumi OISHI.

sen.j: 母は小田貞守(近衛家家臣)の妹外山局。
sen.e: His mother was Toyama no Tsubone, a younger sister of Sadamori ODA (a vassal of the Konoe family).
His mother was Toyama no Tsubone, a younger sister of Sadamori ODA (a vassal of the Konoe family).
His mother was Toyama no Tsubone, a younger sister of Sadamori ODA (a vassal of the Konoe family).

sen.j: 兄に大石信興(信興とも)がいる。
sen.e: His older brother was Nobuoki (or Nobutoyo) OISHI.
sen.cmt: 大石信興(信興とも)→「信豊（のぶとよ）だとも言われる。」http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%A4%A7%E7%9F%B3%E4%BF%A1%E8%88%88
sen.e: His older brother was Nobuoki (or Nobuoki) OISHI.
sen.cmt: 仕様指示書に従い、原文の明らかな間違いをあえてそのままにした訳に変更しました。
sen.e: His older brother was Nobuoki (or Nobuoki) OISHI.

sen.j: 信清は、大石良雄の曽祖父大石良勝の弟大石信云の孫にあたり、要するに信清は大石家の分家である。
sen.e: Nobukiyo was a grandson of Nobukoto OISHI, a younger brother of Yoshikatsu OISHI who was a great-grandfather of Yoshio OISHI, that is, Nobukiyo belonged to a branch family of the Oishi clan.
Nobukiyo was a grandson of Nobukoto OISHI, a younger brother of Yoshikatsu OISHI, who was a great-grandfather of Yoshio OISHI, that is, Nobukiyo belonged to a branch family of the Oishi clan.
sen.cmt: whoの前にコンマを付け、非制限用法としました。
sen.e: Nobukiyo was a grandson of Nobukoto OISHI, a younger brother of Yoshikatsu OISHI, who was a great-grandfather of Yoshio OISHI, that is, Nobukiyo belonged to a branch family of the Oishi clan.

sen.j: 元禄2年(1689年)12月24日に父が大坂にて死去し、長男の信豊が300石、次男の信清が150石をそれぞれ継いだ。
sen.e: In December 24, 1689, his father died in Osaka and thereby Nobutoyo, the first son, inherited three hundreds goku and Nobukiyo, the second son, one hundred and fifty goku.
On December 24, 1689, his father died in Osaka, and thereby Nobutoyo, the first son, inherited 300 goku, and Nobukiyo, the second son, 150 goku.
sen.cmt: 年月日の前置詞を修正しました。コンマを加えました。用語統一リストに従い、数字をアラビア数字にしました。
sen.e: On December 24, 1689, his father died in Osaka, and thereby Nobutoyo, the first son, inherited 300 goku, and Nobukiyo, the second son, 150 goku.

sen.j: 元禄13年(1700年)頃に源蔵から瀬左衛門へ改名している。
sen.e: Around in 1700, Nobukiyo changed his first name from Genzo to Sezaemon.
Around 1700, Nobukiyo changed his common name from Genzo to Sezaemon.
sen.cmt: inが不要なので削除しました。「通称」を変えた、としました。
sen.e: Around 1700, Nobukiyo changed his common name from Genzo to Sezaemon.

sen.j: また大石本家の当主大石内蔵助良雄とともに奥村無我に弟子入りして東軍流を習っている。
sen.e: Moreover, he became a disciple of Muga OKUMURA together with Yoshio OISHI, the family head of the main family of OISHI, to learn the Togun-ryu school.
sen.cmt: 大石内蔵助良雄 → 大石良雄http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%A4%A7%E7%9F%B3%E4%BF%A1%E6%B8%85
sen.e: Moreover, he became a disciple of Muga OKUMURA together with Yoshio OISHI (common name Kuranosuke), the family head of the main family of OISHI, to learn the Togun-ryu school of swordmen.
sen.cmt: 広辞苑から、「大石内蔵助良雄」の「内蔵助」を「通称」としました。「東軍流」が剣術の一派であることがわかるようにしました。
sen.e: Moreover, he became a disciple of Muga OKUMURA together with Yoshio OISHI (common name Kuranosuke), the family head of the main family of OISHI, to learn the Togun-ryu school of swordmen.

sen.j: 元禄14年(1701年)3月14日に主君浅野内匠頭が吉良上野介に刃傷に及んだとき、信清は藩主の参勤交代にお供していたため、江戸にあった。
sen.e: In March 14, 1701, when Asano Takumi no Kami, his lord, injured Kira Kozuke no Suke, Nobukiyo stayed in Edo because he was accompanying the lord of the domain for Sankin-kotai (daimyo's alternate-year residence in Edo).

On March 14, 1701, when Asano Takumi no Kami, his lord, injured Kira Kozukenosuke, Nobukiyo stayed in Edo because he was accompanying the lord of the domain for Sankin-kotai (alternate-year residence in Edo).
sen.cmt: 年月日の前置詞を修正しました。「上野介」に含まれるnoの処理の仕方が、仕様説明書に「姓と名の間に『の』が入る場合」の処理の仕方になっていたので、修正しました（「内匠頭」は官名なので変更なし）。「参勤交代」の説明で、英語で定義されていない「大名」がない方がわかりやすいため、daimyo'sを削除しました。
sen.e: On March 14, 1701, when Asano Takumi no Kami, his lord, injured Kira Kozukenosuke, Nobukiyo stayed in Edo because he was accompanying the lord of the domain for Sankin-kotai (alternate-year residence in Edo).

sen.j: 3月14日夜には第二の使者として原惣右衛門とともに江戸をたって赤穂へ向かう。
sen.e: In the night of March 14, he left Edo for Ako as the second envoy with Souemon HARA.
On the night of March 14, he left Edo for Ako as the second envoy with Souemon HARA.
sen.cmt: 「夜に」の前置詞を適切なOnに変更しました。
sen.e: On the night of March 14, he left Edo for Ako as the second envoy with Souemon HARA.

sen.j: 赤穂城開城後は兄信豊とともに奈良市や京都市で暮らしていたが、元禄15年(1702年)8月の大石の神文返しを機に兄が脱盟したため、兄とは義絶。
sen.e: After the Ako-jo Castle surrendered, Nobukiyo lived in Nara City and Kyoto City with Nobutoyo, his older brother, but disowned Nobutoyo because he withdrew from the alliance after Oishi returned a written oath.

After the Ako-jo Castle's surrender, Nobukiyo lived in Nara City and Kyoto City with Nobutoyo, his older brother, but then disowned Nobutoyo because the brother withdrew from the alliance as he had failed to show enough allegiance when Oishi returned his written oath to judge his loyalty.
sen.cmt: 「赤穂城開城後」のAfter + S + VをAfter + 名詞の形にしました。訳文を理解できるようにするため、「神文返し」について補足しました。参考URL：http://www.nhk.or.jp/sonotoki/2002_12.html
sen.e: After the Ako-jo Castle's surrender, Nobukiyo lived in Nara City and Kyoto City with Nobutoyo, his older brother, but then disowned Nobutoyo because the brother withdrew from the alliance as he had failed to show enough allegiance when Oishi returned his written oath to judge his loyalty.

sen.j: 9月19日に大石主税・間瀬久太夫らとともに江戸へ下向。
sen.e: In September 19, Nobukiyo went down to Edo together with Chikara OISHI, Kyudayu MASE, etc.
On September 19, Nobukiyo went to Edo together with Chikara OISHI, Kyudayu MASE, etc.
sen.cmt: 年月日の前置詞を修正しました。「下向」を直訳するとわかりにくいので、単にwentとしました。
sen.e: On September 19, Nobukiyo went to Edo together with Chikara OISHI, Kyudayu MASE, etc.

sen.j: 江戸到着後は、母方の氏をとって「小田権六」と変名して麹町六丁目吉田忠左衛門借家に入ったが、まもなく大石内蔵助の石町三丁目の小山屋借家に移った。
sen.e: After arriving at Edo, he changed his name to 'Gonroku ODA' adopting the family name of the mother's side and lived in a tenant of Chuzaemon YOSHIDA in 6 chome, Kojimachi, but soon moved to that of Koyamaya in 3 chome, Ishimachi, owned by Kuranosuke OISHI.

After arriving at Edo, he changed his name to 'Gonroku ODA' adopting the family name of the mother's side and lived in a house rented from Chuzaemon YOSHIDA in 6 chome, Kojimachi, but soon moved to another rented place of Koyamaya in 3 chome, Ishimachi, owned by Kuranosuke OISHI.
sen.cmt: tenantは「借家」ではなく「借家人」という意味なので、別の語に変更しました。(moved to) thatのthatの使い方があまりよくないと思われますので、変更しました。
sen.e: After arriving at Edo, he changed his name to 'Gonroku ODA' adopting the family name of the mother's side and lived in a house rented from Chuzaemon YOSHIDA in 6 chome, Kojimachi, but soon moved to another rented place of Koyamaya in 3 chome, Ishimachi, owned by Kuranosuke OISHI.

sen.j: しかし江戸ではだいぶ金に困ったらしく、叔父の大石無人に借金をしている。
sen.e: However, it seems that he had financial trouble in Edo and borrowed money from Mujin OISHI, his uncle.
sen.cmt: 叔父 is written as 伯父 in①http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%A4%A7%E7%9F%B3%E4%BF%A1%E6%B8%85②http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%A4%A7%E7%9F%B3%E7%84%A1%E4%BA%BA
sen.e: It seems that he was really short of money in Edo and was in debt to Mujin OISHI, his uncle.
sen.cmt: 原文の「しかし」の訳出がない方が意味が通るので、Howeverを削除しました。「金に困った」の訳がやや不適切なので変更しました。
sen.e: It seems that he was really short of money in Edo and was in debt to Mujin OISHI, his uncle.

sen.j: 討ち入りの装束も無人に作ってもらっている。
sen.e: Mujin made even a raid's outfit for him.
Mujin even made Nobukiyo's outfit for the raid.
sen.cmt: evenの位置と「討ち入りの装束」の訳を変更しました。
sen.e: Mujin even made Nobukiyo's outfit for the raid.

sen.j: 吉良邸討ち入りでは裏門隊に属した。
sen.e: Nobukiyo belonged to the back gate unit at the raid of Kira-tei Residence.
Nobukiyo belonged to the back gate unit in the raid on Kira-tei Residence.
sen.cmt: 前置詞を修正しました。
sen.e: Nobukiyo belonged to the back gate unit in the raid on Kira-tei Residence.

sen.j: 本懐後、熊本藩細川氏へお預りとなり、元禄16年(1703年)2月4日に細川家家臣吉田近貞の介錯で切腹した。
sen.e: After they completed the raid successfully, he was kept by the Hosokawa clan in the Kumamoto domain and in February 4, 1703, committed suicide by disembowelment with the assistance of Chikasada YOSHIDA, a vassal of the Hosokawa family, who beheaded him.

After they completed the raid successfully, he was kept by the Hosokawa clan in the Kumamoto Domain, and on February 4, 1703, he committed hara-kiri and died of being beheaded by Chikasada YOSHIDA, a vassal of the Hosokawa family.
sen.cmt: 年月日の前置詞を修正しました。コウビルド英英辞典にhara-kiriがありましたので、それを使用しました。「介錯」の部分の訳を変更しました。
sen.e: After they completed the raid successfully, he was kept by the Hosokawa clan in the Kumamoto Domain, and on February 4, 1703, he committed hara-kiri and died of being beheaded by Chikasada YOSHIDA, a vassal of the Hosokawa family.

sen.j: 享年27。
sen.e: He was twenty-seven years old.
He was 27 years old.
sen.cmt: 用語統一リストに従い、数字をアラビア数字にしました。
sen.e: He was 27 years old.

sen.j: 主君浅野内匠頭と同じ高輪泉岳寺に葬られた。
sen.e: He was buried in Sengaku-ji Temple in Takanawa, Tokyo, the same place as Asano Takumi no Kami, his lord.
He was buried in Sengaku-ji Temple in Takanawa, the same burial place as Asano Takumi No Kami, his lord.
sen.cmt: 原文にない「東京」を削除しました。same placeをsame burial place（埋葬場所）としました。
sen.e: He was buried in Sengaku-ji Temple in Takanawa, the same burial place as Asano Takumi No Kami, his lord.

sen.j: 法名は刃寛徳剣信士。
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist name was Tokantokuken-shinji.
His posthumous Buddhist name was Tokantokuken-shinji.
His posthumous Buddhist name was Tokantokuken-shinji.

sen.j: 妻も子もなかったが、従兄弟にあたる大石良麿の子大石良饒が養子に入り、瀬左衛門信清家の家名を今日まで残している。
sen.e: He did not have a wife nor a child, but Ryojo OISHI, a son of Yoshimaro OISHI, who was Nobukiyo's cousin, was adopted and thereby the family name of Sezaemon Nobukiyo remains up until today.
He had no wife and no child, but Ryojo OISHI, a son of Nobukiyo's cousin, Yoshimaro OISHI, was adopted, and Ryojo's descendants have kept the family name of Sezaemon Nobukiyo until today.
sen.cmt: 読みやすくするため、全体的に調整しました。
sen.e: He had no wife and no child, but Ryojo OISHI, a son of Nobukiyo's cousin, Yoshimaro OISHI, was adopted, and Ryojo's descendants have kept the family name of Sezaemon Nobukiyo until today.

sen.j: また切腹前に討ち入りの装束など遺品を大石無人に預けており、この装束は無人の子孫である津軽大石家により代々伝承され、現在は大石神社に納められており、ここで見学することができる。
sen.e: Moreover, Nobukiyo left some articles such as a raid's outfit to Mujin OISHI before committing suicide, and this outfit has been inherited by the Oishi family in Tsugaru, a descendant of Mujin, for generations and now it is possible to see it in the Oishi-jinja Shrine where it is enshrined.

Before committing hara-kiri, Nobukiyo left Mujin OISHI some articles such as his outfit for the raid, which was inherited by Mujin's descendants, the Oishi family in Tsugaru, and is now enshrined in the Oishi-jinja Shrine, where people can see it.
sen.cmt: 読みやすくするため、全体的に調整しました。
sen.e: Before committing hara-kiri, Nobukiyo left Mujin OISHI some articles such as his outfit for the raid, which was inherited by Mujin's descendants, the Oishi family in Tsugaru, and is now enshrined in the Oishi-jinja Shrine, where people can see it.
